title: 105_s170
content: The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" amends definitions in the Wire and Electronic Communications Act to include communication made through a clone pager. It also prohibits the use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers without authorization. Additionally, it amends Chapter 206 of the Act. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. The amendments also cover the use of clone pagers in section 3121 of the Act. The amendments to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, include adding clone pagers alongside trap and trace devices. This extends to section 3121 of the Act as well. The amendments to Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code, now include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. This expansion also applies to section 3121 of the Act. In section 3122 and 3123, the term "trap and trace device" is replaced with "trap and trace device, or a clone pager" throughout. The court can authorize the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or a clone pager for criminal investigations upon application. The amendments now include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. The amendments allow for the use of clone pagers in criminal investigations, providing relevant information for ongoing cases. The amendments allow for the use of clone pagers in criminal investigations, enabling interception of communications by the clone pager in addition to trap and trace devices. The amendments allow for the use of clone pagers in criminal investigations, enabling interception of communications by the clone pager in addition to trap and trace devices. The amendments involve inserting references to clone pagers in various sections of the law related to electronic surveillance. The amendments allow for the use of clone pagers in criminal investigations, enabling interception of communications by the clone pager. A Federal court may order a provider of a paging service to furnish all necessary information and technical assistance for the operation and use of the clone pager upon request by an authorized law enforcement officer. The amendments allow for the use of clone pagers in criminal investigations, enabling interception of communications. A Federal court may order a provider of a paging service to furnish all necessary information and technical assistance for the operation and use of the clone pager unobtrusively. The amendments allow for the use of clone pagers in criminal investigations, enabling interception of communications. Federal court orders may require paging service providers to provide technical assistance for the operation of clone pagers. The amendments to section 3126 and 3127 allow for the use of clone pagers in criminal investigations, defining a clone pager as a device that receives communications intended for another paging device. Federal court orders may require technical assistance from paging service providers for the operation of clone pagers. The Senate passed the bill on November 7, 1997.
